Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> I think mine would still work, I just have an issue with the floppy, it's on endless loop ... guess one of the ICs should be replaced.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> and cleaned!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> clickety clickety click...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> already did that, didn't help

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> and I'm not a master in soldering, so I refrained from removing the IC myself üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> oh, that was another device... That was the ZIP drive... Click of death...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> oh, ZIPs ... I hated them. Totally unstable and always broken when you needed them.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> I har a firewire version, worked reliably for 5  or 6 years...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> we just had SCSIs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> external

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> My father in law had the combined SCSI/parallel version

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> That was a disaster!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> probably same ... just remember SCSI, but may have been that one though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> You had a parallel, SCSI and a combined one... That was about ??? al lot more expensive

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> we had them ad university, for data backup ... well, was more of data breakdown after all

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> The firewire I had from work: one of my colleagues was a soldering whizzkid and replaced the parallel interface for a firewire interface for me

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> we switched to tape instead üòâ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> After that you had the Jazz-drive... I never thoughed that one, though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> those had enormous capacities, compared to other media at that time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Tapes were just as unreliable.... Our Sa's never bothered to verify the backup every once in a while....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> did he? Hm, never had issues with those

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> And when they needed them.... They turned out to be corrupt...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> the trick was an antimagnetic casing ^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> or rather a magnetic shielding, to put that in proper terms

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> If you don't regularly replace the tapes with fresh tapes... After 4 years of continuoes use you cannot expect them to hold all the data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> hm, can't remember a single tape that was corrupt... we used them for about 5 years before CDs came up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> but those were much less reliable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> especially the first versions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> We reccommended to replace your DLT tapes every 2 years for a fresh set

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> We never really used CD for backups, unless a customer wanted a copy. Then we'ld supply them a CD/DVD

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> one of the Professors recommended to print the data, which he considered to be the safest way... we made a joke and made a printout of a program in assembler code and asked him if he could put it back into the computer ... after that, the ZIP drives came in ^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Hihihihi... Just supply the good professor with a thermal printer... Gnagnagna

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> hot needles... oh yeah

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Just like your cash receipt from a supermarket... Leave it in the car for a week during summer.... Not readable!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> doesn't need summer, a strong source of light will be enough

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> indeed.... I would love to see that professors face when he finds out!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> or a weak source and time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> yeah, that's also what I'm always angry about ... you need the bill for guarantee things, but after a year it's bleached ... great

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> I always scan an copy bills I may need for warranty in the future

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> And staple the original to the copy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> i just put them in aluminum foil... also works ... but it's not a treat anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> But, proof of payment should be sufficient, so if you can produce a bankstatement with the payment on it, it should suffice.... Most stores don't accept it without a fuss, though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> luckily most cases happen within the first 2 or 3 weeks, and at least the discounters don't make much fuzz if you bring their stuff back... they just pay you back and put it back into the shelf again... üò¶

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Yeah, indeed. At those places I rummage through until  I find a box that isn't tampered with

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> ok, time for coffee and sun... l8er m8 ^^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> How can the miner control how many coins he's mining at a pool?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Not... if the pool implements a deamon for one of the autochains, you would automatically mine it...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Your miner mines the same hash as now, but since the autochains connect periodically to veruschain, you get the rewards for notarization and mining for all blocks since the last connection (presently 8 blocks)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> So pools can't use the miner's work just for themselves?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> They could, if they sneaked in some extra deamons to mine Autochains not on the site. But that would involve that autochains coin, not the notarization...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Thoskk> hm.. well, if there's a way, somebody will do it I'm afraid
